summary:
“Quality is never an accident; it is always the result of high intention, sincere effort, intelligent direction, and skillful execution; it represents the wise choice of many alternatives.” – William A. Foster
The above quote is one of my favorites and as a Biomedical Scientist, I am passionate about bringing Quality science, meaning a measure of excellence free from defects and significant variations. Few words about who I am.
• I was born in India, moved to England to pursue PhD and post-doctoral studies, and worked for a few years there. I have learned to perform great science and realized what I want to do. 
• I firmly believe in and work for the mission of translational science to bring biomedical research into applications to ameliorate and cure human diseases. 
• Moved to Canada not long ago, love the country, and enjoy doing science here!
• I have enjoyed scientific positions in Research and Development, Process development, and in Quality control throughout my career.
• My passion, experience, and personal development achieved so far are highlighted here to learn more about me:

o I love to discuss science and the ways to translate discoveries!
o My Scientific background to summarize: I am a stem cell and cancer biologist with a special love to satellite cells of skeletal muscle.
o Experienced in designing and developing assays for the small molecules/therapeutic proteins targeting cancer, and cell/gene therapy for human diseases for clinical trials (Phase I, II, and III).
o Another part that I enjoy in addition to doing science is identifying the root cause of the problem to provide corrective action. Working in quality control, as a certified Lead Auditor in ISO 9001:2015 and a black belt holder in Lean Six Sigma, I have learned to troubleshoot starting from bench level to production.
o Acquired knowledge of the ICH, FDA, MHRA, and Health Canada guidelines and applied to the development, production, and release of small molecules.
o Strong coordination skills made it possible to work in multi-disciplinary, cross-functional teams.
o Worked with embryonic stem cells for ASTVAC2 project, on Satellite cells and revealed important information regarding the remodeling of Extracellular matrix components and its effects on stem cell propagation, as well as in regenerative medicine.
o Now working with an excellent team we are on a mission to cure Muscular Dystrophy!


Always happy to connect for science to share knowledge and to discuss translating modern Biomedical research!!

projects.description: Was actively involved in performing and training flow cytometry methods to identify dendritic cells that has been used to AST-VAC2 Vaccine which is now in clinical trials.
projects.title: AST-VAC2 Vaccine in Patients With Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

headline: Passionate Biomedical Scientist aims to bring quality science | Senior Scientist at Satellos | SRA OHRI | Muscle stem cells

courses.name: 1.	Presented one-minute poster presentation in 3 day International Symposium sponsored by the UKIERI held from 8th-10th April 2013 at University of Sheffield.
2.	Presented a poster in “BSDB BSCB JSDB conference” held from April 15-18th2012 at University of Warwick, Coventry, UK
3.	Attended V11, VIII and IX London mycology conferences held on 27th Oct 2010, 7th Dec 2011 and 18th July 2012 held in London, UK
4.	Presented a poster in “BSDB -BSCB conference” held from April 27th-30th 2011 at University of Kent, Canterbury, UK
5.	Watson and Crick Memorial lecture organized by Aurora degree and PG College of science, held on 23rd (2006), Hyderabad, India
6.	Biochemistry in a new millennium/Quiz-organized by Dept of Biochemistry, held on September 3rd- 4th 2005, University college of science, O.U, Hyderabad, India

7.	62nd Board of Research in Nuclear Sciences – Indian Association of Nuclear Chemists and Allied Scientists (BRNS-IANCAS) National Workshop on “Radiochemistry and Applications of Radioisotopes” held at the Dept of Biochemistry, O.U. Hyderabad, India
8.	“III Indo-Australian Conference of Biotechnology” organized by CDFD and Australian government at Ramoji film city in Hyderabad, India

9.	Attended “Third Burnet lecture on Plagues, Pestilences and Influenza” by Noble laureate Peter C.Doherty, held on 16th March 2007 conducted by Center for DNA Fingerprinting and Diagnostics (CDFD) Hyderabad, India.
Participated in Biomedical YES competition (Entrepreneurial programme) University of Nottingham UNIEI and BBSRC, held in Oct 2012 at Stevenage Bioscience Catalyst, GSK, Stevenage, UK
